undergraduate.gpa_requirement: N/A (UK system: A-levels required or equivalent qualifications with typically A*AA to AAA grades)
undergraduate.ielts_requirement: 7.0 overall, with minimum 6.5 in each component
undergraduate.essays_required: Yes, personal statement via UCAS and written work for some courses
undergraduate.supplemental_materials: Written work for some courses; admissions tests required for many courses

costs.tuition_annual_usd: £9,535 (approx. $11,900) for UK/EU students; £27,000 to £59,000 (approx. $33,700 to $73,700) for international students depending on course
costs.total_cost_attendance: Approx. £17,385 to £66,535 ($21,600 to $83,400) depending on residency and course
costs.financial_aid_available: Yes, scholarships and bursaries available, highly competitive for international students

required_courses: Subjects as per course requirements, generally A-levels or equivalent with high grades
Mathematics required for science and engineering courses
Modern Foreign Language or Classical Language where specified
recommended_courses: Further Mathematics for some STEM courses
Additional subjects demonstrating breadth and depth
admission_requirements.extracurricular_importance: Moderately considered; intellectual curiosity and academic potential prioritized

student_life.housing_guarantee: No universal guarantee; many colleges offer guaranteed accommodation for first-year students
student_life.dining_options: College dining halls and catering services vary by college; some offer formal dinners
student_life.study_abroad_programs: Limited undergraduate study abroad, mostly postgraduate exchanges

special_features: Oldest university in the English-speaking world
Collegiate system with over 30 autonomous colleges
Global reputation for academic excellence and research
Extensive tutorial system for personalized learning
